history.text: Hello home alone was a must see movie back in its times. What are your thoughts ?
Hey there, I agree, even just the cover of a young Macauley Culkin is iconic I think.
yes he is. My son love the movie so I still see it till this day. I loved joe pesci in the movie
Ah yeah Joe Pesci, he was good in other movies too. Although this one didn't really fit his usual Italian mafia movies that I'd associate him with.
and I dont know why rotten tomatos would give it such a low score
Agreed, some of the movies RT gave a high score to were absolutely horrid compared to Home Alone.
now I only like the 1st ones the sequels were not as good
I liked 2 but 3 was subpar, especially since they used a different kid, so it just wasn't the same.
you are right they should had the same kid it the movie. I think I would watch it now
and it is a good chiristmas movie too
hello are you there ?
yes sorry, I'm reviewing the new document
ok my fav scene is when they all reunited back at home.
Mine was when he outsmarted them on the staircase with traps and such. I actually didn't remember that they were going to Paris or that they lived in Chicago
I liked it even more cause it was baces in my hometown chicago
Ah yeah it's always fun to recognize streets or landmarks that you've been to in real life, in a movie haha
yes it was so true to home.
Hah I didn't remember the scene with the temporary power outage and that being the reason why Kevin was accidentally left home alone
ha ha. I always wonder how parents could leave the kid at hom ein the first place
that's a solid point

Perhaps that's the reason why RT gave it a low score was because of how "unrealistic" it was, but like I said they have given so many bad movies a great rating. and they usually weren't any more realistic
but the they leave him alone after that there are more movies
it really is a fun movie to watch

Reading this is like almost like rewatching the movie to me. Scranton PA isn't THAT far away from Chicago, maybe 8-9hour drive at the most? that wouldn't even be the most dramatic part of that situation
I do agree with you
I wonder why Kevin was "silent",.what kind of kid wouldn't tell their parents about some burglars? lol
lol  or niebhors or anyone. I mean he did not have a cell but he had a house phone
I have to wonder if RT did a retroactive rating or that was their rating at the time, I don't know how long that organization has been around for
i think from the mid 2000. I want to see this  at the show 28 years ago
yeah it says 1998 I just looked it up
what was the stupidest thing from the movie to you ?
well I dont know about stupidest but I like when the kid ordered a pizza and then played a sound recording of a guy saying "leave it on the door step and get the hell out of here"
I agree to that one lol

uid1response.feedback: I had a browser freeze at one point so I didn't reply for a few minutes but then I replied and discussed the movie through and through. The other user left and I' hope that was sufficient enough. Thank you for the HIT! :)

uid2response.feedback: I had lots of fun with my partner
